paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for BRCA2, including penetrance data and individual records.

patients.phenotype: Intraductal papillary carcinoma, solid carcinoma, complex carcinoma

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Four out of 22 different dogs (ID: 2, 4, 14, 15) showed c.4314A>G—p.(Lys1435Arg) together with c.4283A>C—p.(Thr1425Pro), both in exon 11 of BRCA2 and previously described in the literature as implicated in carcinogenesis of dogs.

Four out of 22 different dogs (ID: 2, 4, 14, 15) showed c.4314A>G—p.(Lys1435Arg) together with c.4283A>C—p.(Thr1425Pro), both in exon 11 of BRCA2 and previously described in the literature as implicated in carcinogenesis of dogs.

Four out of 22 different dogs (ID: 2, 4, 14, 15) showed c.4314A>G—p.(Lys1435Arg) together with c.4283A>C—p.(Thr1425Pro), both in exon 11 of BRCA2 and previously described in the literature as implicated in carcinogenesis of dogs.

Four out of 22 different dogs (ID: 2, 4, 14, 15) showed c.4314A>G—p.(Lys1435Arg) together with c.4283A>C—p.(Thr1425Pro), both in exon 11 of BRCA2 and previously described in the literature as implicated in carcinogenesis of dogs.

functional_data.summary: The c.4314A>G variant is located in the BRC3 repeat domain, which plays a fundamental role in the interaction with the protein RAD51.

variants.segregation_data: The variant was found in affected dogs but not in healthy controls.
variants.additional_notes: The variant was confirmed by Sanger sequencing.
key_quotes: Four out of 22 different dogs (ID: 2, 4, 14, 15) showed c.4314A>G—p.(Lys1435Arg) together with c.4283A>C—p.(Thr1425Pro), both in exon 11 of BRCA2 and previously described in the literature as implicated in carcinogenesis of dogs.

patients.phenotype: Intraductal papillary carcinoma, solid carcinoma, complex carcinoma

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Four out of 22 different dogs (ID: 2, 4, 14, 15) showed c.4314A>G—p.(Lys1435Arg) together with c.4283A>C—p.(Thr1425Pro), both in exon 11 of BRCA2 and previously described in the literature as implicated in carcinogenesis of dogs.

Four out of 22 different dogs (ID: 2, 4, 14, 15) showed c.4314A>G—p.(Lys1435Arg) together with c.4283A>C—p.(Thr1425Pro), both in exon 11 of BRCA2 and previously described in the literature as implicated in carcinogenesis of dogs.

Four out of 22 different dogs (ID: 2, 4, 14, 15) showed c.4314A>G—p.(Lys1435Arg) together with c.4283A>C—p.(Thr1425Pro), both in exon 11 of BRCA2 and previously described in the literature as implicated in carcinogenesis of dogs.

Four out of 22 different dogs (ID: 2, 4, 14, 15) showed c.4314A>G—p.(Lys1435Arg) together with c.4283A>C—p.(Thr1425Pro), both in exon 11 of BRCA2 and previously described in the literature as implicated in carcinogenesis of dogs.

functional_data.summary: The c.4283A>C variant is located in the BRC3 repeat domain, which plays a fundamental role in the interaction with the protein RAD51.

variants.segregation_data: The variant was found in affected dogs but not in healthy controls.
variants.additional_notes: The variant was confirmed by Sanger sequencing.
key_quotes: Four out of 22 different dogs (ID: 2, 4, 14, 15) showed c.4314A>G—p.(Lys1435Arg) together with c.4283A>C—p.(Thr1425Pro), both in exon 11 of BRCA2 and previously described in the literature as implicated in carcinogenesis of dogs.

functional_data.summary: The c.10204_10206insAAA variation is positioned in the nuclear localization signal 2 (NLS2), which plays a key role in the mislocation of BRCA2 in humans.

variants.segregation_data: The variant was found in affected dogs but not in healthy controls.
variants.additional_notes: Recent studies suggest that c.10204_10206insAAA may be associated with significantly higher mammary tumor morbidity rates in dogs.
key_quotes: We found this insertion in 18 out of 22 dogs (81%) in exon 27 of BRCA2.

tables_processed.table_caption: Summary of genetic variants identified in BRCA2

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data for BRCA2 variants were extracted successfully.
